ðŸš€ tiktokenizer | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Calculating the number of tokens for a given prompt to optimize usage of OpenAI models.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Online playground â€¢ Token calculation for prompts â€¢ Integration with openai/tiktoken â€¢ Built with T3 Stack
ðŸ“– Summary: The Tiktokenizer repository is an online playground for the `openai/tiktoken` library. It allows users to calculate the number of tokens required for a given prompt, which is crucial for working with OpenAI models and managing API costs. The project is built using the T3 Stack and is sponsored by Diagram.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ noisedash | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Creating and customizing ambient noise soundscapes for relaxation, focus, or other purposes.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Generate and customize ambient noises using Tone.js â€¢ Save, import, and export noise profiles â€¢ Fine-tune noises with audio processing tools (filters, LFOs, effects) â€¢ Upload and edit audio samples
ðŸ“– Summary: Noisedash is a self-hostable web application designed for generating and customizing ambient noises. It allows users to create personalized soundscapes by combining generated noises with uploaded audio samples, applying audio processing effects, and saving noise profiles for easy access and sharing. The application also includes admin tools for managing multiple users and is designed to be mobile-friendly.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ receipthero | TypeScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Organizing and managing receipts with AI-powered data extraction and categorization.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ AI-powered OCR using Together AI â€¢ Data extraction (vendor, date, amount, items, currency, payment method) â€¢ Automatic expense categorization â€¢ Local data storage for privacy â€¢ Spending breakdown visualization
ðŸ“– Summary: ReceiptHero is an open-source receipt management application that uses AI-powered OCR to extract data from receipt images. It allows users to upload receipts, automatically categorize expenses, and view spending breakdowns, storing data locally for privacy.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ Code2Video | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Generating educational videos based on code execution and logic.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Video generation from code â€¢ Educational video creation â€¢ Code-centric paradigm â€¢ Multi-agent system utilization (implied)
ðŸ“– Summary: Code2Video is a project focused on generating educational videos from code. It presents a code-centric paradigm for creating teaching videos, potentially leveraging multi-agent systems to automate the video creation process. The project provides resources such as a paper, dataset, and project website for further exploration.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ”¥ doomscroll-detector | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Detecting and discouraging doomscrolling behavior.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ YOLOv11 pose estimation for keypoint tracking â€¢ YOLO object detection for phone detection â€¢ Heuristics for detecting reclined posture based on hip/shoulder alignment â€¢ Heuristics for detecting phone holding based on wrist proximity â€¢ Overlay of results on webcam feed with a spoofed penalty counter
ðŸ“– Summary: The Doomscrolling Detector is a computer vision pipeline that identifies when a user is reclined and using their phone, indicative of doomscrolling behavior. It uses pose estimation and object detection to flag these instances, and includes a spoofed penalty counter as a humorous deterrent.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ WZML-X | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Mirroring and cloning files from various online sources to different cloud storage platforms or Telegram.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ qBittorrent support with file selection and seeding options â€¢ Aria2c integration with file selection, netrc support, and authentication â€¢ Telegram upload/download with file splitting, thumbnail support, and leech options â€¢ Support for uploading files to specific Telegram supergroups
ðŸ“– Summary: WZML-X is a Telegram bot built with Pyrogram that enhances file mirroring and cloning capabilities. It supports downloading from various sources like torrents, Mega, Google Drive, and direct links, then uploading to Google Drive, Telegram, Rclone clouds, or DDL servers.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ UpUp | JavaScript
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing offline access to website content for users with intermittent or no internet connectivity.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Offline functionality using service workers â€¢ Simple JavaScript API for configuration â€¢ Control over offline content â€¢ Browser support for Chrome, Opera, and Firefox (with service worker support)
ðŸ“– Summary: UpUp is a JavaScript library that enables offline functionality for websites by utilizing service workers. It allows developers to specify content to be displayed when users are offline, ensuring a consistent user experience even without an internet connection. The library is designed to be easy to implement, requiring only a few lines of JavaScript to configure.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
